# join()

**Instance Method**

Starts the shared activity on the current device.

## Declaration

```swift
final func join()
```

## Discussion

Call this method to begin the delivery of synchronized data to the current device. Typically, you call this method when your app is ready to engage in an activity. For example, call it when you present your app’s UI for the activity. When your app successfully joins the session, the session changes the value in its [doc://com.apple.GroupActivities/documentation/GroupActivities/GroupSession/state-swift.property] property to [doc://com.apple.GroupActivities/documentation/GroupActivities/GroupSession/State-swift.enum/joined].

## Joining and leaving the session

- **leave()**: Leaves the current activity and stops receiving synchronized data.
- **end()**: Ends the activity for the entire group and stops the transfer of synchronized data.
